sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Job's appeal Being a funeral discourse delivered at Northonnam in York-shire, upon occasion of the death of Mr. Jonathan Denton, wherein a Christian's state is stated before God, and his sufferings from the hand of God cleared. Grounded upon Job X.7. By Oliver Heywood, minister of the gospel. Heywood, Oliver, 1629-1702.
[8], 24 p.
printed for B. Aylmer, at the Three Pigeons over against the Royal Exchange in Cornhill, London : 1695.
Running title reads: A funeral sermon. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Job's appeal Being a funeral discourse delivered at Northonnam in York-shire, upon occasion of the death of Mr. Jonathan Denton, wherein a Christian's state is stated before God, and his sufferings from the hand of God cleared. Grounded upon Job X.7. By Oliver Heywood, minister of the gospel. Heywood, Oliver, 1629-1702.
[8], 24 p.
printed for B. Aylmer, at the Three Pigeons over against the Royal Exchange in Cornhill, London : 1695.
Running title reads: A funeral sermon. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
B. Aylmer
the Three Pigeons over against the Royal Exchange in Cornhill
